title: Novel

articles.content:
A novel is a long, fictional story about human beings and the events of their
lives. The four essential attributes of a novel are: Theme—Plot—Characterization—Style.
articles.attribution:
“Basic Principles of Literature,”
The Romantic Manifesto, 80

articles.content:
A good novel is an indivisible sum: every scene, sequence and passage of a good
novel has to involve, contribute to and advance all three of its major
attributes: theme, plot, characterization.
articles.attribution:
“Basic Principles of Literature,”
The Romantic Manifesto, 93

articles.content:
Since the theme of a novel is an idea about or pertaining to human existence,
it is in terms of its effects on or expression in human actions that that idea
has to be presented.
articles.attribution:
“Basic Principles of Literature,”
The Romantic Manifesto, 82
